Method Detail

outputFromPrototype

public static void outputFromPrototype(javax.xml.transform.Source viewSource,
                                       javax.xml.transform.Source modelSource,
                                       javax.xml.transform.Result viewResult)
                                throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
The simplest and most flexible way to create the output

Parameters:
viewSource - the annotated view prototype
modelSource - the dynamic data
viewResult - what you should send to the client
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

outputFromPrototype

public static void outputFromPrototype(javax.xml.transform.Source viewSource,
                                       javax.xml.transform.Source modelSource,
                                       javax.xml.transform.Result viewResult,
                                       java.util.Map params)
                                throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Sometimes you wish to pass in parameters that come from another source than the model. The key in the map should have a toString method returning a String corresponding to a parameter in the view declared with a weffo-param processing-instruction. The value in the map is recommended to be a String, but the supported types of Object depend on the transformer implementation.

Parameters:
viewSource - the annotated view prototype
modelSource - the dynamic data
viewResult - what you should send to the client
params - the parameters
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

outputFromPrototype

public static void outputFromPrototype(javax.xml.transform.Source viewSource,
                                       javax.xml.transform.Source modelSource,
                                       javax.xml.transform.Result viewResult,
                                       java.util.Map params,
                                       javax.xml.transform.URIResolver uriResolver)
                                throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
To access other xml data than the model, the recommended approach is to pass in a URN as a parameter value (e.g. "urn:UserPrefs" ) and create a URIResolver implementation to return a Source with your other xml data. When your URIResolver returns null for a requested resource, the transformer will proceed and try and find it in a normal way (e.g. convert it to an URL). The data is then accessed in the view by "document($param)/XPathSelector".

Parameters:
viewSource - the annotated view prototype
modelSource - the dynamic data
viewResult - what you should send to the client
params - the parameters
uriResolver - your URIResolver implementation
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

public static javax.xml.transform.Templates templateFromPrototype(javax.xml.transform.Source viewSource)
                                                           throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Creates a cacheable, reusable template for generating a view

                                          javax.xml.transform.Result transformResult)
                                   throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Creates a transform for generating a view
